poem:
Title: "In Ruinous Velocity"

Two small birds dart across the boulevard,
Pulled by strings of gleaming boyish laughter.
Suddenly, Mercedes growls, a silver shard
In sunshine, bearing down - the grim thereafter.
Silent jury, justice in your hands so rested,
Mark and brother's fate, in moments, tested.
The whisper of tires, the hush of the street,
A city's heart beats, asynchrony meets.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jury to decide fate of LA socialite for fatally striking two kids with her car More than three years ago, a Los Angeles socialite allegedly fatally struck two young boys as they were crossing the street. Now a jury will decide whether Rebecca Grossman is guilty of second-degree murder, vehicular manslaughter and hit-and-run driving. This week jurors heard opening statements in the long-awaited trial of Grossman for the deaths of brothers Mark Iskander, 11, and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
